excerpts:
APPETIZERS

$4.55 Jalapeno Poppers - 5 fried jalapenos filled w/ cream cheese
$4.55 Mozzarella Sticks - 7 fried breaded mozzarella cheese sticks - super cheesy
$4.55 Zucchini Chips - 10 breaded slices of zucchini
$4.55 Onion Rings - 5 battered onion rings, fried

Lots of fried items.
The zucchini chips are hot and steamy inside.
zucchini chips.author: Joy W.
zucchini chips.review:
I struggle most with assigning a rating. This time, I want to say it's a 5/10. 
Uncle Boy's serves up burgers and fried things in a simple, no-frills, neighborhood spot. It's clear they're big fans of Manny Pacquiao.
They cook up the food on the flat grill right by the doorway. There is a small fridge for beverages in the back. There are just a couple of small tables, so it's mostly a takeout spot. The seats are usually occupied, so I just order for takeout, or call for pickup. The food is tasty, greasy, and messy.

I've tried the following...

APPETIZERS

$4.55 Jalapeno Poppers - 5 fried jalapenos filled w/ cream cheese
$4.55 Mozzarella Sticks - 7 fried breaded mozzarella cheese sticks - super cheesy
$4.55 Zucchini Chips - 10 breaded slices of zucchini
$4.55 Onion Rings - 5 battered onion rings, fried

Lots of fried items. They are mostly all crunchy & heavily breaded. The jalapenos are a little too spicy for me. The zucchini chips are hot and steamy inside. I couldn't even tell what they were until I bit through one.


FINGER FOODS

$6.59 Wings - 8 deep fried:
not bad chicken wings, a little petite


BURGERS
The burgers are pretty juicy & tasty and usually quite messy. I've seen them weigh out slabs of ground beef, shape & flatten them into thin, uniform patties. The cheese is always nicely melted over the patty. The buns are toasted, too. I don't like the shredded lettuce, as it becomes soft and wilted. Takeout orders are especially messy and often dripping with sauce.
Prices aren't too bad for a small business establishment.

$7.49 Nephew - grilled angus beef patty, jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, topped w/ pesto mayo in toasted bun:
good, basic burger with juicy beef patty. I can't really taste the pesto mayo though.

$7.49 Cowboy - grilled angus beef patty, American cheese, bacon, onion rings w/ BBQ ranch sauce in toasted bun:
crunchy, oily onion rings & juicy patty. I could definitely taste the BBQ sauce in this one.

$7.49 Italian Stallion (formerly Mamma Mia) - pepper jack cheese, 3 mozzarella sticks, lettuce, marinara sauce in toasted bun:
also crunchy & oily, with gooey, stringy mozzarella

$7.49 Hip-Poppin - grilled angus beef patty, jalapeno poppers stuffed w/ cream cheese, jack cheese, lettuce & tomato in toasted bun:
also good, a little too spicy for me, but manageable with all the cheesy ingredients

$7.49 Hot Mess - grilled angus beef patty, bacon, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, jalapenos topped w/ hot mess sauce in toasted bun:
good, way too spicy for me

They also serve chicken sandwiches, vegan burgers, and hot link sandwiches.

Now I've been pretty satisfied with most of the things I tried. How could I not be? It's high-calorie fried food meant to satiate grumbling hunger pains. It was a good fallback option when you're too tired to cook and need something filling.
However, I haven't returned in a while. I recall they had some serious management issues. There were many times I noticed Uncle Boy's only had one person working in the entire place; taking orders in person, taking orders on the phone, cooking, handling payment, and cleaning. Well actually, poor guy had no spare time for cleaning. No wonder it's hard to get through their phone line when placing a phone order. Need I mention sanitary issues having only one cook deal with cash payments too? 
After a couple of times of dealing with extremely slow service, I can't even call it fast food anymore. Nobody should have to wait 45 minutes for a burger to go. When other patrons asked why he was on his own, he replied that the owner was too cheap to pay more staff members. I was surprised that he was so blunt, but I would be disgruntled too. I don't know if they still deal with bottleneck problems during peak times (especially right around closing time), but it's worth mentioning for people who are strictly looking for a time-saving option.

excerpts: *Zucchini chips ($4.55)

zucchini chips.author: Elena N.
zucchini chips.review:
September 18, 2014: National Cheeseburger Day

On the way home, the roommate asked me what I wanted for dinner. Remembering that it was national cheeseburger day, I said, "A cheeseburger please?!" We decided to stop by Uncle Boy's since we've never been.

*Cowboy ($7.49) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#LfZ2jAKg0gRL3BwUkI4ovA
*Hot mess ($7.49) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#FV2dbqLFIDrqbAmMXEJV-A
*French fries ($3.25) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#ex2RPXRePVhFmIi7Cx2unA
*Zucchini chips ($4.55) http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#Vb6vbjR_GIGYmsg8CqW7QQ
*Sauces: Chipotle, Ranch & Pesto mayo http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/uncle-boys-san-francisco#rGLwiSq5LcynFW4j6f2CBg

The burgers were pretty average. Nothing was really special or stood out about them. I hate to say this, but I thought they were similar to burgers from Carl's Jr. The cowboy reminded me of the bacon western cheeseburger. At least the price point here isn't too bad. The one thing I did like was that they offered different sauces to try with everything.

As with average places and middle of the road reviews, 3 stars it is!

excerpts: You can chose between mozzarella sticks, french fries, jalapeño poppers, zucchini chips or onion rings.
I also ordered a side of onion rings and the BBQ wings (8 piece).
zucchini chips.author: Jen M.
zucchini chips.review:
Lunch time coming up and since Uncle Boys was close to my place, I decided to try this place.

I ordered pickup from Eat24. I ordered the Cowboy Burger as a combo, which includes a drink and mozzarella sticks. The last item being a choice. You can chose between mozzarella sticks, french fries, jalapeño poppers, zucchini chips or onion rings. I also ordered a side of onion rings and the BBQ wings (8 piece). There are other flavors beside BBQ, but I just wanted that one.

I went to pick up my food then head on home to eat. The mozzarella sticks were okay, crisp on the outside. The onion rings were delicious.

The wings tastes good by itself. The wings were crisp and crunchy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. The BBQ sauce comes in a separate container that you can pour over the wings. 

The burger...yum. I ordered with the beef cooked medium rare and it was perfect. The beef was so tender and the sauce! The onion rings was a great combo and the bacon, oh my. The bacon was two thick slices sandwiched in between the beef patty and the bun. It was soooo delicious.

Next time I'm feeling hungry, I'm going to get me that burger again. Maybe it was just my hunger talking but I'm pretty sure it was all my taste buds. Great food and close by, Uncle Boy is a great choice.

excerpts: mmM Bacon and fried zucchini chips!
zucchini chips.author: Jerry S.
zucchini chips.review:
I have too many great late night memories involving walking to uncle boys and for that you deserve your 5 stars! 
Am I right guys? 

This is the place you take your friends looking for an authentic burger spot in the city without all that snooty bullshit. 

I still stick by my previous review about the food, it's excellent!! I love my food gluttonous and you get that here with all the fried goodies on a lot of the burgers. 
mmM Bacon and fried zucchini chips!

excerpts: Their zucchini chips taste like oil and bad decisions while their nuggets feel premade and ordered from a grocery store but without the reliable taste.
Back to their burgers though, almost every sandwich is a great choice and they have something for everyone.
I don't eat beef
and Ive found that their chicken sandwiches are so good!
Not much for vegetarians or vegans though, sad to say.
But the place is nice and small and the food comes out pretry fast!
zucchini chips.author: Stephanie R.
zucchini chips.review: Their burgers and fries are great but mothing else really stands out. Their zucchini chips taste like oil and bad decisions while their nuggets feel premade and ordered from a grocery store but without the reliable taste. Back to their burgers though, almost every sandwich is a great choice and they have something for everyone. I don't eat beef and Ive found that their chicken sandwiches are so good! Not much for vegetarians or vegans though, sad to say. But the place is nice and small and the food comes out pretry fast!

excerpts: Oh and the fried zucchini chips, while amazing in theory, also lost their race against soggy time.
zucchini chips.author: Kelsey G.
zucchini chips.review:
Uhhhh holy buckets. 

Be warned: This review was for a veggie burger.  Don't judge me; shit was delicious. 

I actually had Postmates bring me food, because lazies. Food delivery is always a gamble with anything that may offer a race against the sogginess clock. However, I basically devoured this burger in 4 bites. (Super graceful image, I know.)

I got the Ain't No Punk which comes with a flame broiled garden patty, cheese, fried zucchini, chipotle sauce and the other usual produce suspects. I also added grilled onions because why wouldn't you add grilled onions. 

For the most part, gotta say this thing, along with the onion rings, held up on its delivery trek. Although, towards the end of me trying to take this burger down, the chipotle sauce stared eating through the bread. Oh and the fried zucchini chips, while amazing in theory, also lost their race against soggy time. 

For anyone complaining about the small portions of onion rings - HOW MUCH FOOD DO YOU NEED? I couldn't even look at those things after slamming down a burger. I may not be a growing college freshman but I can eat some fewds. I applaud you, Uncle Boy's. For at least taking a non-gluttonous stand on one of your menu items.

excerpts: Ended up ordering two sides because I couldn't pick between the mozza sticks and the zucchini chips.
Both were bomb.
Would definitely come again to try out those rings!
zucchini chips.author: Moe A.
zucchini chips.review: Well priced, great burgers with amazing options as sides. Took me about a half hour to decide which burger I wanted because they all sounded amazing (kept it safe with the Hot Mess). Ended up ordering two sides because I couldn't pick between the mozza sticks and the zucchini chips. Both were bomb. Would definitely come again to try out those rings!

excerpts: so we ordered fries, zucchini chips and onion rings.
All were delicious!
Seating is limited so be prepared to stand for a bit-well worth it though!
The staff were super friendly and sweet.
I'll be back for sure!
zucchini chips.author: Michelle A.
zucchini chips.review: Amazing food and service!  I ordered the main chick and the OG with cheddar cheese.  We couldn't decide on the sides so we ordered fries, zucchini chips and onion rings. All were delicious! Seating is limited so be prepared to stand for a bit-well worth it though! The staff were super friendly and sweet. I'll be back for sure!

excerpts: The only reason I'm subtracting a star is because once I went and wanted zucchini chips and they were out and
another time I went and they were closed to fix something for an unknown amount of time...
zucchini chips.author: Maggie F.
zucchini chips.review:
OMG so delicious. The only reason I'm subtracting a star is because once I went and wanted zucchini chips and they were out and another time I went and they were closed to fix something for an unknown amount of time...but with that being said...

This is one of my favorite places for a burger in the city. I always get the one with bacon and ranch on it (I think the pool boy?). 

I love that this place isn't trying to be kitchy or hip...it's a burger joint and that's all. YUM!

excerpts: Mozzarella sticks, zucchini chips, jalapeño poppers, the list goes on.
Docked a star cuz patty was nothing phenomenal.
Still a well crafted burger.
I got the "Pool Boy" Can't wait to try the rest of the menu.
Workers were really friendly and encouraged social media promotion which tells me they like the place enough.
EAT HERE NOW!
zucchini chips.author: Matt M.
zucchini chips.review: First impressions are hard to shake off and this place did everything right. Simple components done really well. Buns, patty, fries, the bacon. Come here for the nonstandard fixings. Mozzarella sticks, zucchini chips, jalapeño poppers, the list goes on. Docked a star cuz patty was nothing phenomenal. Still a well crafted burger. I got the "Pool Boy" Can't wait to try the rest of the menu. Workers were really friendly and encouraged social media promotion which tells me they like the place enough. EAT HERE NOW!

excerpts: great burger, great zucchini chips--hot and fresh
zucchini chips.author: Quincy S.
zucchini chips.review: great burger, great zucchini chips--hot and fresh

excerpts: the fries were also cold, yet the zucchini chips were burned.
zucchini chips.author: Molly E.
zucchini chips.review:
my boyfriend and i came here recently, and our experience was beyond horrible. it was also extra sad because i was really excited to finally have found a good burger place in the richmond (what are these other reviewers thinking??)!!!

our burgers were cold and overdone, complete with overcooked bacon, and missing the jalapenos. the fries were also cold, yet the zucchini chips were burned. worst part--i think we paid about $30 for the whole mess.

i feel bad because the guy cooking/handling cash was obviously overwhelmed, but maybe they should employ another person or two if he can't handle it solo.

excerpts: Chicken fritters is a must try.
All white meat is always moist and tender.
chicken fritters.author: Jen L.
chicken fritters.review: Chicken fritters is a must try. All white meat is always moist and tender.

it's a vegeterian soy burger.
cooked near medium rare.
-taste mostly veggies, seasoning, patty had no taste.
-taste just average, am sure the burgers or chicken would have tasted better.

garden burger.review:
Uncle Boy's i've heard of; 
lst time seeing them.
no posted menu. offerings just on 2 sided flyer. one side had chicken, other had burgers or so i thought.

excerpts: They burnt the Garden burger my friend ordered.
garden burger.author: Neil T.
garden burger.review:
I was excited to try this place after reading reviews but was unexpectedly disappointed. 
In the end, they showed good customer service in response to our disappointment, but I still wouldn't eat here again.

1. I specifically called this place to order delivery as advertised on yelp. They said they don't deliver. 

2. We were told to pickup in 30 minutes. We arrived 45 minutes later thinking our burger would be ready. They hadn't even started so we waited 20 more minutes.

3. They burnt the Garden burger my friend ordered. The Cowboy burger was pretty good, but had very little of the sauce, making the burger dry. The meat itself was yummy but the whole burger wasn't anything amazing.

4. Our mozzarella sticks were cold.

In the end, when we brought the concern of the 1 hour wait to their attention, they only charged us $8 for 2 burgers and mozzarella sticks. They were also very apologetic. This was good customer service. Good luck, Uncle Boys!

excerpts: Ordered the Garden Burger with fries and the Ain't No Punk.
Fries were underwhelming, as were the burners.
Same generic veggie patty in each, the latter with ok-but-flavorless fried zucchini slices.
They were both pretty dry.
The bottom of the buns were weirdly dense.
garden burger.author: Grant P.
garden burger.review: Ordered the Garden Burger with fries and the Ain't No Punk. Fries were underwhelming, as were the burners. Same generic veggie patty in each, the latter with ok-but-flavorless fried zucchini slices. They were both pretty dry. The bottom of the buns were weirdly dense.

excerpts: I got the Aint No Punk Veggie burger which was fantastic!
Moderately spicy and flavorful.
aint no punk.author: Andrew A.
aint no punk.review:
Came here with my girlfriend visiting from LA. Stopped for a bite to eat before hitting the museum. Such a great eating experience! The place is small but more cozy than anything. The two people working there were extremely polite and charismatic. They seemed genuinely interested in getting to know us and that's all before we ate! 

The food was delicious. $10.00 and some change gets you a hearty burger, lots of fries, and a drink.  I got the Aint No Punk Veggie burger which was fantastic! Moderately spicy and flavorful. My girlfriend ordered the "El Jefe" burger which was really spicy but great for anyone who's up for it.

excerpts: I ordered the italian stallion and my boyfriend ordered the OG burger (double patty add cheese) .
Love the simplicity of the OG- your classic cheeseburger and super flavorful with a hefty bun to hold all in the ingredients intact.
og burger.author: Kathryn S.
og burger.review:
Ordered delivery via Grubhub. I ordered the italian stallion and my boyfriend ordered the OG burger (double patty add cheese) . Love the simplicity of the OG- your classic cheeseburger and super flavorful with a hefty bun to hold all in the ingredients intact. Double patty was a little too much might even settle for the single patty next time. 

The Itallian Stallion was delicious. Single patty with pepper jack cheese, marinara sauce, lettuce AND MOZZERELLA STICKS (add grilled onions and bacon). Also an extremely delicious burger. the bacon was thick and crisp and was in every bite, the mozzerella sticks were well seasoned and delicious and every thing just worked really well together. 

Also ordered side of mozerella sticks which we already established were delicious, and french fries. 
The fries are why this place isnt getting five stars. I dont know if I got an old batch or what happened but the fries were really dry and almost stale :/ Delivery also only took about 10 minutes once I got the notification that it was picked up from the restaurant so I dont know what happened but they arent worth ordering again imo.  

Overall- really delicious burgers and will be adding to the list of delivery options

excerpts: I just had the OG burger
but it was delicious!
Very juicy and tasty!
Can't wait to go back!
og burger.author: Dave L.
og burger.review: I live around the corner from Uncle Boy's and have always been meaning to try it but my wife was just totally not interested. She went out of town for a few days so I decided to finally give it a go. I was not disappointed! I just had the OG burger but it was delicious! Very juicy and tasty! Can't wait to go back!

excerpts: I recommend the OG burger with grilled onions.
og burger.author: Bryan H.
og burger.review: Delightful little restaurant. Stopped in for a quick afternoon meal and the burger and fries were an incredible surprise. The burger was perfectly juicy and the mustard and grilled onions completed a delicious burger. The fries were freshly fried, crispy and hot. What's best is that all of it was under $10, a rare commodity for this area. Hit this place up for a quick, delicious meal. I recommend the OG burger with grilled onions.

excerpts: The OG burger was neatly stacked and wrapped, juicy and really good.
Also tried the chicken tenders which were pretty much extra large chicken nuggets but they were crispy, moist and pretty tasty.
og burger.author: Jeany K.
og burger.review:
A great hole in the wall burger joint. Tiny place with just a couple tables and some counter space. 

Sunday afternoon, the grill was manned by one person but our food was served up quickly. The high school girls behind the counter added to a great experience. Friendly, cheerful and helpful.

The OG burger was neatly stacked and wrapped, juicy and really good. Also tried the chicken tenders which were pretty much extra large chicken nuggets but they were crispy, moist and pretty tasty.

excerpts: Mmm, just had an OG burger with cheese and it was cooked perfectly, just the way I like it.
This place is no fuss no muss with zero pretension.
Tiny place without much charm
but I think low overhead means their prices are extremely reasonable.
I was going to eat in but
because of the size and the less than Charming atmosphere I decided to take my meal to go
and that's the main reason I'm giving 4 out of 5 stars because I would have liked the atmosphere to be a little nicer and more comfortable.
And would it kill them to do milkshakes?
That's what I was really craving with the burger!
A big menu posted on the wall would be much better than looking at those little paper ones.
Some small, thoughtful changes and this place, I think, would attract many more customers.
But I went for a burger and I got a great one
and that's what counts most.
og burger.author: Dee C.
og burger.review: Mmm, just had an OG burger with cheese and it was cooked perfectly, just the way I like it. This place is no fuss no muss with zero pretension. Tiny place without much charm but I think low overhead means their prices are extremely reasonable. I was going to eat in but because of the size and the less than Charming atmosphere I decided to take my meal to go and that's the main reason I'm giving 4 out of 5 stars because I would have liked the atmosphere to be a little nicer and more comfortable. And would it kill them to do milkshakes? That's what I was really craving with the burger! A big menu posted on the wall would be much better than looking at those little paper ones. Some small, thoughtful changes and this place, I think, would attract many more customers. But I went for a burger and I got a great one and that's what counts most.

excerpts: We usually get the basic, OG burger with cheese and sometimes bacon.
Today we got the hot mess protein-style and the Nephew.
Both burgers lasted aprrox 2 min.
og burger.author: Pete M.
og burger.review:
Today marked the 5th time I've eaten from Uncle Boy's.  Figured its time to write a review.  Always juicy burgers, always well-cooked fries (crunchy outside, soft inside.)  We usually get the basic, OG burger with cheese and sometimes bacon.  Today we got the hot mess protein-style and the Nephew.  Both burgers lasted aprrox 2 min.  They were super delish...as usual.

Its a great spot to have close by.  And its awesome that they are open on Sunday right about the time I'm feeling the need for day-after comfort.  Three burgers, 2 fries, $31.  A little on the high side but its the price to pay for good quality, fast & friendly service.

excerpts: I love the OG burger.
They are very accomodating when it comes to what you want on your burger.
My whole family of 12 came in and we took up all the tables.
Such a friendly, and great customer service.
The next time we are in town, we hope to come here again.
og burger.author: Lainie P.
og burger.review: I love the OG burger. They are very accomodating when it comes to what you want on your burger. My whole family of 12 came in and we took up all the tables. Such a friendly, and great customer service. The next time we are in town, we hope to come here again.

excerpts: I always go for the OG burger with cheddar cheese - which is your basic burger that comes with lettuce, tomatoes, onion, ketchup, mayo, mustard - and it never lets me down.
Totally hits the spot.
The buns are delicious and come from a local baker.
The place is a bit small, so I usually take my order to go and walk over to golden gate park which is about 2 blocks away and find a nice little spot to eat there.
og burger.author: Kristina O.
og burger.review: Uncle Boy's is hands down my favorite burger spot in the city! I always go for the OG burger with cheddar cheese - which is your basic burger that comes with lettuce, tomatoes, onion, ketchup, mayo, mustard - and it never lets me down. Totally hits the spot. The buns are delicious and come from a local baker. The place is a bit small, so I usually take my order to go and walk over to golden gate park which is about 2 blocks away and find a nice little spot to eat there.

excerpts: I get their standard OG burger or chicken sandwich.
Both are good.
I don't love their more complex burgers but who cares.
The food is always hearty, fresh tasting, and reasonable.
og burger.author: Courtney C.
og burger.review: I am always surprised by this unassuming spot.  I get their standard OG burger or chicken sandwich.  Both are good.  I don't love their more complex burgers but who cares.  The food is always hearty, fresh tasting, and reasonable.

excerpts: The only thing i would recommend is that the Grillmeister should ease up on the mustard on the OG burger because it over powers the taste.
og burger.author: John B.
og burger.review: After dropping off my clothes to soap box dry cleaners down the street came across uncle boys burger joint. Decided to yelp before heading in and decided to give it a try. Looking at their menu it had a couple of good burger and decided to try the Mama Mia burger which had : 1 grilled Angus beef patty, 1 slice of jack cheese, and 4 mozzarella sticks, lettuce, and finished with zesty marinara sauce all in a toasted bun. My Girlfriend tried the OG(original) burger. We got our order within 5-10 minutes. Took a bite of my burger and fell in love very tasteful and the mozzarella cheese sticks went well with the burger. The french fries were really good as well. The only thing i would recommend is that the Grillmeister should ease up on the mustard on the OG burger because it over powers the taste.

excerpts: The OG burger is pretty awesome and the assortment of other burgers & chicken based burgers with various topping mixtures should suit pretty much everyone.
If not, then go ahead and augment one of them to your liking.
Burgers, burger-like sandwiches made with chicken or veggie-patty, and various fried items are all they have on the menu, but they make up for it by being open till 3AM.
Way better
that Jack-in-the-Box after leaving the bars.
og burger.author: Joel F.
og burger.review:
I'm Filipino and I have an Uncle Boy so when this place opened up I had to stop in for a burger. I'm not sure if they still have lumpia on the menu, but that and the picture of Manny Pacquiao at the register are the only things linking Uncle Boy's with anything Filipino.
The OG burger is pretty awesome and the assortment of other burgers & chicken based burgers with various topping mixtures should suit pretty much everyone.  If not, then go ahead and augment one of them to your liking.
Burgers, burger-like sandwiches made with chicken or veggie-patty, and various fried items are all they have on the menu, but they make up for it by being open till 3AM.  Way better that Jack-in-the-Box after leaving the bars.

excerpts: I think it was the OG burger?
With Bacon?
Oh yeah.
A great, filling burger with DEEP FRIED BACON.
So yummy.
The fries are yummy and crispy too!
og burger.author: Jennifer L.
og burger.review:
I like that Uncle Boy's stays open late.  It definitely satisfied my burger craving after drinking one too many cucumber gimlets on a Saturday night.  After reminding my boyfriend and friends (sorry guys) that I wanted a burger about 20 times, they finally gave in.  I don't remember what we ordered...I think it was the OG burger?  With Bacon?  Oh yeah.  A great, filling burger with DEEP FRIED BACON.  So yummy.  The fries are yummy and crispy too!  Oh yeah.

The service was great...One of the owners of the place was running the register and he was super nice and welcoming, despite the various amounts of late night eaters and drunkies walking in (ahem...by drunkies, I guess I meant me...)

Another "Good Eats" in my hood!  Woohoo!

excerpts: This time he got the OG burger, which I think is just like his nephew burger, except without the pesto.
I got the Mama Mia burger, which had fried mozzarella sticks in it plus marinara sauce.
It was huge.
And it was filling.
He also got two orders of fries.
og burger.author: Kris L.
og burger.review:
I didn't think I'd like Uncle Boy's, but I actually do.  A stopped by last week to pick up a burger to snack on.  I believe he got a nephew burger or something.  It's pretty much a regular burger, but with pesto inside.  I love pesto!  He also got an order of fries.  I absolutely LOVE LOVE LOVE their fries.  I think it's the seasoning they put on it, but it tastes so good!

Anyway, we went back again this week because A liked his first burger so much.  This time he got the OG burger, which I think is just like his nephew burger, except without the pesto.  I got the Mama Mia burger, which had fried mozzarella sticks in it plus marinara sauce.  It was huge.  And it was filling.  He also got two orders of fries.  Ah, the fries!

If there's a lot of people, expect a wait.  The two times we've been there, it's just been one guy running the place, so he took the orders, collected the cash, and made the burgers and fries.  Even though we were the only people there both times, we still had to wait a while.  But was it worth the wait.

Oh yes it was!

excerpts: The beef is perfectly cooked for the OG burger, it's too bad that I shared it with a friend cause I would've eaten 10 burgers if I knew it was that good!
Way to go guys.. hope you could expand your branch in the near future!
og burger.author: Sarah A.
og burger.review: I cannot begin to describe how tasty their O.G. burger is. I would go there every single day if I could! Even though the wait is long, and the place is super tiny.. their burgers are deffinetely worth it! The staff are SUPER friendly and their buns are so fresh. The beef is perfectly cooked for the OG burger, it's too bad that I shared it with a friend cause I would've eaten 10 burgers if I knew it was that good! Way to go guys.. hope you could expand your branch in the near future!

excerpts: The Cowboy Burger is great if you're looking for something juicy and filling- can't go wrong with beef, bacon, and onion rings inside a bun.
The Chicken-Bella is also a solid choice if you're not a red-meat eater.
If you can order ahead of time and pick up, that's the way to go.
cowboy.author: Grace L.
cowboy.review: Uncle Boy's is our go-to burger joint in the Inner Richmond. It's nothing fancy but the burgers and fries will fill you up. Though it's a small restaurant, expect at least a 15 minute wait for your food. The Cowboy Burger is great if you're looking for something juicy and filling- can't go wrong with beef, bacon, and onion rings inside a bun. The Chicken-Bella is also a solid choice if you're not a red-meat eater. If you can order ahead of time and pick up, that's the way to go.

excerpts:
$7.49 Cowboy - grilled angus beef patty, American cheese, bacon, onion rings w/ BBQ ranch sauce in toasted bun:
crunchy, oily onion rings & juicy patty.
cowboy.author: Joy W.
cowboy.review:
I struggle most with assigning a rating. This time, I want to say it's a 5/10. 
Uncle Boy's serves up burgers and fried things in a simple, no-frills, neighborhood spot. It's clear they're big fans of Manny Pacquiao.
They cook up the food on the flat grill right by the doorway. There is a small fridge for beverages in the back. There are just a couple of small tables, so it's mostly a takeout spot. The seats are usually occupied, so I just order for takeout, or call for pickup. The food is tasty, greasy, and messy.

I've tried the following...

APPETIZERS

$4.55 Jalapeno Poppers - 5 fried jalapenos filled w/ cream cheese
$4.55 Mozzarella Sticks - 7 fried breaded mozzarella cheese sticks - super cheesy
$4.55 Zucchini Chips - 10 breaded slices of zucchini
$4.55 Onion Rings - 5 battered onion rings, fried

Lots of fried items. They are mostly all crunchy & heavily breaded. The jalapenos are a little too spicy for me. The zucchini chips are hot and steamy inside. I couldn't even tell what they were until I bit through one.


FINGER FOODS

$6.59 Wings - 8 deep fried:
not bad chicken wings, a little petite


BURGERS
The burgers are pretty juicy & tasty and usually quite messy. I've seen them weigh out slabs of ground beef, shape & flatten them into thin, uniform patties. The cheese is always nicely melted over the patty. The buns are toasted, too. I don't like the shredded lettuce, as it becomes soft and wilted. Takeout orders are especially messy and often dripping with sauce.
Prices aren't too bad for a small business establishment.

$7.49 Nephew - grilled angus beef patty, jack cheese, lettuce, tomato, topped w/ pesto mayo in toasted bun:
good, basic burger with juicy beef patty. I can't really taste the pesto mayo though.

$7.49 Cowboy - grilled angus beef patty, American cheese, bacon, onion rings w/ BBQ ranch sauce in toasted bun:
crunchy, oily onion rings & juicy patty. I could definitely taste the BBQ sauce in this one.

$7.49 Italian Stallion (formerly Mamma Mia) - pepper jack cheese, 3 mozzarella sticks, lettuce, marinara sauce in toasted bun:
also crunchy & oily, with gooey, stringy mozzarella

$7.49 Hip-Poppin - grilled angus beef patty, jalapeno poppers stuffed w/ cream cheese, jack cheese, lettuce & tomato in toasted bun:
also good, a little too spicy for me, but manageable with all the cheesy ingredients

$7.49 Hot Mess - grilled angus beef patty, bacon, cheddar cheese, lettuce, tomato, onions, jalapenos topped w/ hot mess sauce in toasted bun:
good, way too spicy for me

They also serve chicken sandwiches, vegan burgers, and hot link sandwiches.

Now I've been pretty satisfied with most of the things I tried. How could I not be? It's high-calorie fried food meant to satiate grumbling hunger pains. It was a good fallback option when you're too tired to cook and need something filling.
However, I haven't returned in a while. I recall they had some serious management issues. There were many times I noticed Uncle Boy's only had one person working in the entire place; taking orders in person, taking orders on the phone, cooking, handling payment, and cleaning. Well actually, poor guy had no spare time for cleaning. No wonder it's hard to get through their phone line when placing a phone order. Need I mention sanitary issues having only one cook deal with cash payments too? 
After a couple of times of dealing with extremely slow service, I can't even call it fast food anymore. Nobody should have to wait 45 minutes for a burger to go. When other patrons asked why he was on his own, he replied that the owner was too cheap to pay more staff members. I was surprised that he was so blunt, but I would be disgruntled too. I don't know if they still deal with bottleneck problems during peak times (especially right around closing time), but it's worth mentioning for people who are strictly looking for a time-saving option.

excerpts: I ordered the Cowboy Burger as a combo, which includes a drink and mozzarella sticks.
The last item being a choice.
cowboy.author: Jen M.
cowboy.review:
Lunch time coming up and since Uncle Boys was close to my place, I decided to try this place.

I ordered pickup from Eat24. I ordered the Cowboy Burger as a combo, which includes a drink and mozzarella sticks. The last item being a choice. You can chose between mozzarella sticks, french fries, jalapeño poppers, zucchini chips or onion rings. I also ordered a side of onion rings and the BBQ wings (8 piece). There are other flavors beside BBQ, but I just wanted that one.

I went to pick up my food then head on home to eat. The mozzarella sticks were okay, crisp on the outside. The onion rings were delicious.

The wings tastes good by itself. The wings were crisp and crunchy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. The BBQ sauce comes in a separate container that you can pour over the wings. 

The burger...yum. I ordered with the beef cooked medium rare and it was perfect. The beef was so tender and the sauce! The onion rings was a great combo and the bacon, oh my. The bacon was two thick slices sandwiched in between the beef patty and the bun. It was soooo delicious.

Next time I'm feeling hungry, I'm going to get me that burger again. Maybe it was just my hunger talking but I'm pretty sure it was all my taste buds. Great food and close by, Uncle Boy is a great choice.

excerpts: My wife really liked the Cowboy Burger and my daughter said that these are the best mozzarella sticks that she's ever had, and she's tried many throughout the country.

cowboy.review: This place had good reviews on Yelp and within walking distance of our doctor appointment. The Italian Stallion Burger was so tasty. My wife really liked the Cowboy Burger and my daughter said that these are the best mozzarella sticks that she's ever had, and she's tried many throughout the country. Very personable staff. Great prices. We will definitely return when we are in the area.

excerpts: Got the cowboy, added jalapeños, bursting with flavor.
And can't possibly go wrong with fried zucchini, right?

cowboy.author: Chris S.
cowboy.review:
Friggin legit burgers. Got the cowboy, added jalapeños, bursting with flavor. And can't possibly go wrong with fried zucchini, right? One of my favorites. One of my favorite burger places in the city (the other is thirsty bear, which also has great beer). 

There isn't much room inside, so don't expect to sit down in peak hours. It's a cute little place in the middle of a neighborhood. Open decently late too which is a major plus. 

Only downside is the pricing. It's not unreasonable, but these burgers ain't cheap either. 12 for a combo...I guess that isn't so bad. I've been spoiled by how cheap some of the Asian food in the area is.

excerpts: The Cowboy burger is my go-to.

The mozzarella sticks are wonderful, as are the fries.
cowboy.author: James E.
cowboy.review:
Uncle Boys is a solid burger operation serving the Richmond district. Prices are moderate; food and service is great. 

Depending on the time of day, orders take around 10-15 minutes. They accept credit and debit if you order for pickup through the Yelp app, meaning you can walk in and walk right out if you want. Just order ahead en route. 

The Cowboy burger is my go-to. Highly recommend for those who've never been to UB before. The mozzarella sticks are wonderful, as are the fries.

excerpts: My husband and I got the Cowboy Burger with fries.

cowboy.author: Marie L.
cowboy.review:
My husband and I got the Cowboy Burger with fries. We're always searching for a great burger for a good price. Half the time, we don't need the full restaurant experience that jacks up the price. 

The only reason I didn't do 5 stars is I think the cook got overwhelmed and was messing up on the customization on a lot of the orders. I think it took us about 25 minutes to get our order.

We will be back when we're on this side of town.

excerpts: The Cowboy burger was pretty good, but had very little of the sauce, making the burger dry.
cowboy.author: Neil T.
cowboy.review:
I was excited to try this place after reading reviews but was unexpectedly disappointed. 
In the end, they showed good customer service in response to our disappointment, but I still wouldn't eat here again.

1. I specifically called this place to order delivery as advertised on yelp. They said they don't deliver. 

2. We were told to pickup in 30 minutes. We arrived 45 minutes later thinking our burger would be ready. They hadn't even started so we waited 20 more minutes.

3. They burnt the Garden burger my friend ordered. The Cowboy burger was pretty good, but had very little of the sauce, making the burger dry. The meat itself was yummy but the whole burger wasn't anything amazing.

4. Our mozzarella sticks were cold.

In the end, when we brought the concern of the 1 hour wait to their attention, they only charged us $8 for 2 burgers and mozzarella sticks. They were also very apologetic. This was good customer service. Good luck, Uncle Boys!

excerpts: I ordered the cowboy burger - onion rings, cheese bacon, chargrilled Angus burger on a toasted bun.
cowboy.author: Chris F.
cowboy.review:
While traveling you learn not to let location and first impressions of a place fool you; Uncle Boy's is  one of those places.

I ordered the cowboy burger - onion rings, cheese bacon, chargrilled Angus burger on a toasted bun.

Hands-down the best burger I've had in the city and by far the most underrated burger joint in SF.

excerpts: we ordered one cowboy burger meal (including fries well done & a soda).
When the nice griller was plating up our burger and fries he couldn't fit all the fries in the basket with the burger...
I asked him to cut  the burger too, and when he did, he placed it into 2 baskets and added all the "extra" fries (which filled an entire basket).
cowboy.author: Amy W.
cowboy.review:
Do you ever notice how some places treat you like a 2nd class citizen once they find out you have a Groupon?, and then glare at you even worse when you try and not over-spend on the Groupon amount...

NOT THIS PLACE, if anything, they went the extra mile to make you feel MORE comfortable and welcoming (and isn't that the point of Groupons, to make you want to go back and generate positive word of mouth?)

I went with a $10 Groupon. I am "trying" to eat less, so 2 of us went to split a burger and fries.  we ordered one cowboy burger meal (including fries well done & a soda).  When the nice griller was plating up our burger and fries he couldn't fit all the fries in the basket with the burger... I asked him to cut  the burger too, and when he did, he placed it into 2 baskets and added all the "extra" fries (which filled an entire basket). He also made sure to mention that we could have as much fountain soda as well liked. 

The other nice touch was the offering of BBQ sauce for the fries.

I will go back based on the delish and huge burger/fries, BUT more importantly I was to patronize a business that is clearly all about customer service.

excerpts: They know my order when I come in (get the Cowboy burger).

cowboy.review: Great burgers, friendly service. One of my absolute favorite local stops. The people there are great, got to know them as a regular. They know my order when I come in (get the Cowboy burger).

excerpts:
After reading a few reviews, the cowboy seemed to be the #1 seller, so we tried the Cowboy and the Hot Mess. 

Winners: hot mess, cowboy
cowboy.author: Thomas L.
cowboy.review:
Found this place randomly browsing the deals on scoutmob. The burgers here are perfectly cooked - charred and crispy on the outside, warm/juicy in the inside. After reading a few reviews, the cowboy seemed to be the #1 seller, so we tried the Cowboy and the Hot Mess. 

Service: Excellent and very friendly

Losers: -1 star for not honoring the full  50% (up to 10$) scout mob discount.  Somehow the 50% was only applied to the first $10. 

Winners: hot mess, cowboy

Overall: 8/10

I'll definitely revisit, thanks Uncle Boy
