The staff is great, great customer service, burgers are delish, fries and onions rings are theeee bomb and everything is made in perfection. I went to Burgermeister the week after I had my week of Uncle Boys burgers and I was so disappointed because it wasnt the same. Uncle Boys is definitely way better than Burgermeister! I think Jon should get add another chain all over bay area cuz Uncle Boys needs to be known by the whole bay area.

excerpts: and I shared an unhorsed cowboy burger which had all the fix-ins (lettuce, tomato, onions)
and on top of that 2 strips of bacon and onion rings with their cowboy sauce, which I assume to be some sort of southwestern chipotle of some sort.
We subbed the meal deal with zucchini fries AND got mozzarella sticks, whew.
Their burger patty kind of reminds me of the whopper from BK or Carls Jr., and IDK if that's a good thing, but I know some people dig that.
They make their patties fresh from what I saw the last time we were there.
They took the ground beef and formed patties right before our eyes!
But they cook them nice and well done
so there's a bit of a charred/crisp.
I suppose you can ask them not to cook it as long if you don't like that?
cowboy.author: Stine H.
cowboy.review:
This place is just fantastic. You can thank San Francisco for being good and reliable for having good eats open late on the weekend. 3AM!!!

Anyhow, uncle boy's is a tiny burger joint that offers a great variety of different burgers and finger foods. (They even have lumpia??) Many specialty burgers with specialty sauces, along with my favorite fried finger foods such as zucchini fries, mozzarella sticks, fries, chicken wings etc. Prices are decent, it's not expensive and for less than $10 you can get yourself a pretty good meal.

The last time I was here, the bestie and I shared an unhorsed cowboy burger which had all the fix-ins (lettuce, tomato, onions) and on top of that 2 strips of bacon and onion rings with their cowboy sauce, which I assume to be some sort of southwestern chipotle of some sort. We subbed the meal deal with zucchini fries AND got mozzarella sticks, whew. Their burger patty kind of reminds me of the whopper from BK or Carls Jr., and IDK if that's a good thing, but I know some people dig that. They make their patties fresh from what I saw the last time we were there. They took the ground beef and formed patties right before our eyes! But they cook them nice and well done so there's a bit of a charred/crisp. I suppose you can ask them not to cook it as long if you don't like that? I prefer mine well done though, so it doesn't matter much to me.

Tons of food and a drink for about $15. Everything was really good, and now whenever I'm taking the 31 past Uncle Boys I'll be thinking of those burgers...Definitely recommended! Not many other burger joints in this area (that I can think of?)

excerpts: I ordered a cowboy with onions, pepper and zucchini.
It was pure bliss to have that burger; perhaps one of the best burgers I have had in a long time.
The price was not unreasonable but was a bit high as compared to other restaurant, but overall, I had a great experience and would definitely be coming again.
cowboy.author: Pocho G.
cowboy.review: Came on a Saturday and was a great decision. The place was packed and I had to wait a while to place my order. It is a small cozy looking place with great food and amazing people, the staff was super nice and helpful. I ordered a cowboy with onions, pepper and zucchini. It was pure bliss to have that burger; perhaps one of the best burgers I have had in a long time. The price was not unreasonable but was a bit high as compared to other restaurant, but overall, I had a great experience and would definitely be coming again.

excerpts: My favorites are the "unhorsed cowboy" (Bacon cheese burger with onion rings) and his side chick (grilled chicken with spicy sauce).
cowboy.author: Nate C.
cowboy.review:
Great burger joint! My favorites are the "unhorsed cowboy" (Bacon cheese burger with onion rings) and his side chick (grilled chicken with spicy sauce). The prices are very good considering the amount of food and quality. 

I'd say one downside is if you want to go with a group of people, the seating is limited. Just a few small tables along the wall and some seating by the window. Also, i've been lucky enough to go when it wasn't really busy so service has been really good, but I can see how people have to wait awhile because there is usually only one guy working there at a time.

If you're in the inner richmond area, these are the best burgers you'll find.

excerpts: I got the Cowboy and it was great!
Had a variety of burger styles!
However, service wasn't that great
and it took forever to get our food.
They also messed up orders and appeared really unorganized.
Maybe I just caught them at a bad time, but the customer service was sub par.
cowboy.author: Kevin S.
cowboy.review: I got the Cowboy and it was great! Had a variety of burger styles! However, service wasn't that great and it took forever to get our food. They also messed up orders and appeared really unorganized. Maybe I just caught them at a bad time, but the customer service was sub par.

excerpts: I've had the Pool Boy and Unhorsed Cowboy, both amazing burgers.
Perfectly juicy patty, toasted bun, condiments and sides at the right proportion to meat and bread.
The burger is something that comes together perfectly and one you just can't stop eating.
cowboy.author: Brian C.
cowboy.review:
I rarely give out 5 stars, because I rely on Yelp so much that I feel that the 5 star rating is something sacred, only given out to the establishments that truly deserve the rating so others who are looking at the star rating, can make an accurate assessment of how the place is.  Of all the places that Yelp has recommended to me, I can only say Phils BBQ in San Diego and Uncle Boy's truly deserve the 5 star rating.

A tiny hole in the wall type of restaurant in the middle of apartment buildings in the inner Richmond, Uncle Boy's is very unassuming.  A hint of Filipino inspiration, from the name to the Pacquiao pic inside show what the owners were thinking.  There are literally only 3 tables, each a 2 person table inside with a bar counter.  The couple times i've been there, there's only 1 guy working.  He takes your order and cooks it to order right there in front of you.  Cups for drinks are all laid out on the counter for you to help yourself because the employee can literally see if you take a cup and hadn't paid for it.  It's the the type of tiny restaurant that makes you a believer in small business and how someone can get it so right.

Food wise, I've tried many burgers in San Francisco, most recommended to me by Yelp and this burger is by far the best.  In the Inner Richmond, others might say Bills Place or Buffalo Burger but Uncle boys far outpaces them.  I've had the Pool Boy and Unhorsed Cowboy, both amazing burgers.  Perfectly juicy patty, toasted bun, condiments and sides at the right proportion to meat and bread.  The burger is something that comes together perfectly and one you just can't stop eating.  The fries are very crispy and amazing compliment to the burger.

Don't let the unassuming curb appeal detract you from Uncle Boys, this place is legit and something everyone should try.

excerpts: My boyfriend and his grandpa both had the Cowboy and they both really enjoyed it, and
cowboy.author: Aimée S.
cowboy.review:
This review is a little late, but my boyfriend and his grandparents and I went here at the end of January.

We were heading to the Conservatory of Flowers for the afternoon, and we needed to stop for lunch before we actually hit the park proper. My boyfriend found this place on Yelp and thought it would be a good choice. When we walked in, I was definitely side-glancing at him for not picking a place with more seating, as his grandparents aren't really very spry. We got lucky that the take-out orders that people were waiting for came up pretty fast, so we took two of the two-person tables.

The food itself was really good. I got the Pool Boy, and the burger was juicy and well flavored without too much extra stuff, everything was really well balanced, with nice crisp veggie toppings. The fries were deliciously seasoned with just a touch of salt and pepper.

My boyfriend and his grandpa both had the Cowboy and they both really enjoyed it, and though I can't recall what his grandma got, she finished the whole thing, which surprised us all.

For the price and quality of the food, this is definitely a great joint to stop by when in the area.

excerpts: Tried the cowboy burger and it was good but a little too meaty and greasy for me.
I liked the onion rings a lot more than my actual burger.
I do wish that they served burgers with mushrooms or avocados though.
That way I feel a little less greasy after.
cowboy.author: Tina L.
cowboy.review: Tried the cowboy burger and it was good but a little too meaty and greasy for me.  I liked the onion rings a lot more than my actual burger.  I do wish that they served burgers with mushrooms or avocados though.  That way I feel a little less greasy after.

excerpts:
- The unhorsed cowboy (bacon, cheese, onion rings, sweet bbq sauce) is the BOMB
-
They cook their bacon in the deep fryer, making it super crispy!
cowboy.author: Ronald T.
cowboy.review:
Pros:
- You can tell the meat is hand-prepared. Do you guys mix onion with it? 
- The unhorsed cowboy (bacon, cheese, onion rings, sweet bbq sauce) is the BOMB
- They cook their bacon in the deep fryer, making it super crispy!
- Their fries are crispy, well-seasoned, and a perfect complement to any burger you order. 

Cons? 
- I drunkenly stumbled here late this past Halloween night and they were packed (usually it's never too overly busy). They only had two people on deck. Not really their fault though.

excerpts: I ordered the unseated cowboy and the OG burger[me and the gf].
They were good.
For $2 more you can get a soft drink and a good amount of french fries (they put pepper in their fries).
Then all of a sudden a big swarm of young adults came and they place was packed.
cowboy.author: Jeff C.
cowboy.review:
I finally got a chance to get parking during dinner time! I went in here and there was only 1 customer in front of me. I ordered the unseated cowboy and the OG burger[me and the gf]. They were good. For $2 more you can get a soft drink and a good amount of french fries (they put pepper in their fries). Then all of a sudden a big swarm of young adults came and they place was packed. They only had 1 worker servicing all these orders and cooking up the burgers.

The decor inside was similar to what my room would be decorated like back in high school. Bunch of 49ers posters, SF Giants posters, and a Manny Pacquiao photo at the register. I was thinking to myself maybe the owners are Filipino? because every Filipino person has an Uncle Boy. lol

excerpts: I got the "unhorsed cowboy" burger meal and the "bacon link" hotlink sandwich.
To make the most out of the discount, add jalapenos and other extras!
cowboy.author: Dominic T.
cowboy.review:
Came here yesterday to use the Scoutmob deal with some friends for lunch. The motto is "small menu, big taste" which is pretty much true. The menu is straight forward like Ike's Place but less extravagant. The burgers are similar but with a difference of one or two items/sauce(s).

The burger meal includes a 21 oz soda and straight-cut fries for $8.95. The burger itself is $6.95. Since the Scoutmob deal has a maximum $10 discount, I opted to get a hotlink sandwich as well. Price for sandwiches are flat $6.95 for all varieties and $8.95 for meal. I got the "unhorsed cowboy" burger meal and the "bacon link" hotlink sandwich. To make the most out of the discount, add jalapenos and other extras! I wish I did since jalapenos are only $.50 more.

There are only 2 tables to sit down so count on taking orders to-go or if you are comfortable standing then there is area for that. It didn't take long for the food to cook. I ate the burger first and it was quite tasty. I really like sticking fries into my burger rather than eating all of them supplementary so you might want to try that. I really like the crunch to almost every bite, yummy. Add pepper for more taste too.

The hotlink sandwich was also yummy but I preferred the burger. I have been craving a hotlink for weeks and I finally got a good fix here. Even with my huge appetite and high metabolism, I wasn't able to finish the last 1/4 of the sandwich but I did in the car after I left.

One complaint is that there is no compost bin. Coming back from Berkeley, seeing a compost bin is almost a must anywhere, especially in SF where it is mandated. We'll definitely come back if we're in the area.

excerpts:
this is how a burger should be eaten... with bacon, onion rings, and cowboy sauce/bbq sauce
-his
side chick- for your chicken needs
cowboy.author: Christine K.
cowboy.review:
I LOVE UNCLE BOY'S!!!

I believe I have to thank one of those Groupon/Living Social Deals that introduced me to this place... because now it has created a lifelong friendship of where I want to get my awesome burger fill.

There are so many good burger joints in the city, but this one is truly GREAT.  Small place with a few tables and usually a Giants game on in the back, you are greeted always by the nicest guys who just want to give you a damn good burger.

Favs:
-unhorsed cowboy- this is how a burger should be eaten... with bacon, onion rings, and cowboy sauce/bbq sauce
-his side chick- for your chicken needs, please match it with chipotle sauce (or that pesto sauce is pretty damn good too!)

Match that up with their lovely thick fries and a drink.... MMM... that is one tasty burger!

Parking situation is not bad.  Bring your friends, because they will love you for it.

P.S.  I'm guessing their lumpias are ridiculously awesome only because I have NEVER been able to order one!  Probably because I find myself here after work or too late in the game.  If they are there, you should probably order some.

excerpts: I had the Pool Boy Burger and my wife had the Cowboy!
100% a really good burger!
Definitely returning!
cowboy.author: Eric B.
cowboy.review: Was looking for a good local burger. Saw this place every time I drive by. Decided tonight was the night. I had the Pool Boy Burger and my wife had the Cowboy! 100% a really good burger! Definitely returning!

excerpts: Staff was friendly and the burgers were great, especially the Cowboy burger.
If you like small places with a great food and a great feel, this is the place.
cowboy.author: Eric R.
cowboy.review: Staff was friendly and the burgers were great, especially the Cowboy burger.  If you like small places with a great food and a great feel, this is the place.

excerpts: My go-to is the "Unhorsed Cowboy," and really anything with their deep fried bacon is amazeballs.
The fries are on the thicker side but seasoned very well.
Discount for students and Giants fans.
cowboy.author: Allison R.
cowboy.review:
I moved to the Inner Richmond about 6 months ago and as my boyfriend and I continue our hunt for nommy food in the area, I gotta give Uncle Boy's props. They've only been open for under a year and are still working out the kinks with their menu options, pricing, etc., but every time I go in there the staff are always really nice and get the job done quick. My go-to is the "Unhorsed Cowboy," and really anything with their deep fried bacon is amazeballs. The fries are on the thicker side but seasoned very well. Discount for students and Giants fans. Good dudes doing good business.

(Suggestion - any chance y'all will get some avocado? I'd be all over that.)

excerpts: My favorite has always been the cowboy with bacon, cheese, bbq sauce, onion rings.
The fries are perfectly seasoned too!
The place is pretty small, maybe 10ish seats and is very...casual.
Come hungry!
cowboy.author: Britt T.
cowboy.review: These burgers are big, juicy, hot, and delicious! My favorite has always been the cowboy with bacon, cheese, bbq sauce, onion rings. The fries are perfectly seasoned too! The place is pretty small, maybe 10ish seats and is very...casual. Come hungry!

excerpts: I usually get the unhorsed cowboy, because it's a great combo, but all the burgers that they cook are fresh every time.
Most combos are not too expensive, and the employees are always nice and helpful.
I only took off one star because it's such a small place, but the food and overall quality are great!
cowboy.author: Sean F.
cowboy.review:
I have been to this place a few times, and it has been great each and every time I have gone. It's easily accessible by the 31, and it's not hard to find. 

I usually get the unhorsed cowboy, because it's a great combo, but all the burgers that they cook are fresh every time. Most combos are not too expensive, and the employees are always nice and helpful. I only took off one star because it's such a small place, but the food and overall quality are great!

excerpts: I got the "unhorsed cowboy" last week, bacon cheese beef onion rings and a deeelish sauce.
Totally rocked my life.
My boyfriend got the big popper or something...
it had jalapeño poppers and cheese and sour cream.
snagged a bite, though i liked my cowboy more his was still good.
cowboy.author: Jenn F.
cowboy.review:
I love this place, I go here more than my arteries would like. I do wish they would go back to hand cut fries though and bring back lumpia. WHY NO MORE LUMPIA WHYY?! :[

I also really love the new special burgers. I got the "unhorsed cowboy" last week, bacon cheese beef onion rings and a deeelish sauce. Totally rocked my life. My boyfriend got the big popper or something... it had jalapeño poppers and cheese and sour cream. snagged a bite, though i liked my cowboy more his was still good.

If you haven't tried uncle boys yet, you're missing out. I love having an option other than chinese and pizza. Yeah they're open late, but go at a normal time when you'll actually remember how good the food was the next day.

excerpts: We ordered the Unhorsed Cowboy, Pool Boy and fries.
The flavor combinations were fantastic.
Great burgers, great toppings, and the seasoned fries were also great.
Do not expect a fancy restaurant, white glove service or white linens - just great food at a very reasonable price.
cowboy.author: Jim H.
cowboy.review: Great burgers, great fries, great price. We ordered the Unhorsed Cowboy, Pool Boy and fries. The flavor combinations were fantastic. Great burgers, great toppings, and the seasoned fries were also great. Do not expect a fancy restaurant, white glove service or white linens - just great food at a very reasonable price.

excerpts: The Cowboy also has deep fried bacon, but adds deep fried onion rings to the stack.
The fries come from a bag in the freezer, but are well cooked by a nice staff behind the counter.
cowboy.author: Jolie N.
cowboy.review:
If you're looking to grub on a well-made tasty burger this is your place.  Girls, this is not the place to bring your new "diet."  Let loose--they make a mean burger & they are masters with the deep fryer.   

I've had a few burgers from this place, both were good.  The HOT Mess is my favorite.  It's a spicy sauced topped creation with bacon.... Well, not just any kind of bacon, deep fried to a crispy, yummy, textural surprise when you bite into your pile of messy meaty goodness.  The Cowboy also has deep fried bacon, but adds deep fried onion rings to the stack.  The fries come from a bag in the freezer, but are well cooked by a nice staff behind the counter.

excerpts:
Some must tries
Hip Popper (add bacon)
Unhorsed Cowboy 
Hot Mess (make it a double)
Tweety and Porky (awesome chicken sandwich)
cowboy.author: Jay S.
cowboy.review:
I wish there were more uncle boys, I was so sad when had to move to the east bay. The food is amazing best burgers in the city hands down.
Some must tries
Hip Popper (add bacon)
Unhorsed Cowboy 
Hot Mess (make it a double)
Tweety and Porky (awesome chicken sandwich)

The hot link sandwiches are rocking.

excerpts: I had the Unhorsed Cowboy, and enjoyed every bite of that burger!
Fries are OK, I'm not really a french fry fan though.
The burger is good - not an award winning "Best of the Bay" type hamburgers, but very good!
Bacon, American Cheese, 2 Onion Rings, and special BBQ "cowboy" sauce...you will not leave hungry!
cowboy.author: James P.
cowboy.review: If you're out in the Richmond District, and in the mood for a good ole burger, hit up Uncle Boy's. I had the Unhorsed Cowboy, and enjoyed every bite of that burger! Fries are OK, I'm not really a french fry fan though. The burger is good - not an award winning "Best of the Bay" type hamburgers, but very good! Bacon, American Cheese, 2 Onion Rings, and special BBQ "cowboy" sauce...you will not leave hungry!

excerpts: I went with the Mama Mia, and it was good, but my buddies got the Cowboy
and I was a little envious.
I'll have to return to try it.
cowboy.author: Alfredo A.
cowboy.review: Great little place. Prices are awesome and so is the food. I went with the Mama Mia, and it was good, but my buddies got the Cowboy and I was a little envious. I'll have to return to try it.

excerpts: I had the cowboy, and it was great.
Bacon was perfectly crisp, not too much sauce, meat was done nicely, yummy onion rings.
Their fries are good too, perfect balance of salt and pepper.
Highly recommend :)
cowboy.author: Milla K.
cowboy.review: Delicious. I had the cowboy, and it was great. Bacon was perfectly crisp, not too much sauce, meat was done nicely, yummy onion rings. Their fries are good too, perfect balance of salt and pepper. Highly recommend :)

excerpts: Definitely recommend getting the Cowboy burger with onion rings, bacon and bbq sauce!
cowboy.author: Elizabeth B.
cowboy.review: HUGE burgers, great service and open late.  Definitely recommend getting the Cowboy burger with onion rings, bacon and bbq sauce!

excerpts: I had an Unhorsed Cowboy meal and it was fantastic.
I was especially impressed by the guy at the cashier, I think his name was Allan (maybe not)

You'd think with such limited space and so many people things would be hectic but he kept everything moving smoothly, from keeping all the sacues filled, the tables clean and ready and giving out excellent recommendations on what food was right for the moment.
cowboy.author: Eric R.
cowboy.review:
I Absolutely LOVE Uncle Boys. Easily the best late night place for young people from Van Ness to Ocean  Beach.  I had an Unhorsed Cowboy meal and it was fantastic. I was especially impressed by the guy at the cashier, I think his name was Allan (maybe not) You'd think with such limited space and so many people things would be hectic but he kept everything moving smoothly, from keeping all the sacues filled, the tables clean and ready and giving out excellent recommendations on what food was right for the moment. Wish I could have his ploiteness and effiency at every place in the city.

Only down side was the wait (who would have thought a place could be packed at 2am) but the staff was entertaining the food was more then worth than worth it. Keep up the great work Uncle boys, boys. I will definitely be back

excerpts: ordered the unhorsed cowboy, thought the meat was a little small, but the combination of bacon, onion rings and whatever else was on there was awesome.
that
cowboy.author: James C.
cowboy.review:
definitely one of my better bad decisions!

ordered the unhorsed cowboy, thought the meat was a little small, but the combination of bacon, onion rings and whatever else was on there was awesome.  that and it wasn't very filling 

tiny mom and pop joint with hardly any room to sit. Call in and order for pick up

excerpts: got two unhorsed cowboy combos for $10.
without the coupon i'd probably give this place 3 stars.
the unhorsed cowboy tasted very similar to a western bacon cheeseburger at carls jr.
fries were piping hot.
the side of lumpia my sister ordered was not very good.
cashier and cook
we both really friendly.
it may take a while to get your food when this place gets busy.
cowboy.author: B Y.
cowboy.review: 4 star rating factors in 50% off scoutmob discount. google it. got two unhorsed cowboy combos for $10. without the coupon i'd probably give this place 3 stars. the unhorsed cowboy tasted very similar to a western bacon cheeseburger at carls jr. fries were piping hot. the side of lumpia my sister ordered was not very good. cashier and cook we both really friendly. it may take a while to get your food when this place gets busy.

excerpts: I got the Nephews burger which had a slice of jack, lettuce, tomatoes and pesto sauce.
There were two  employees there, one female and one male.
Thank goodness that the female was making our burgers, as the male didn't seem to regard taking off his gloves when he was doing certain things.
nephews burger.author: Cat C.
nephews burger.review:
Hole in the wall burger place in an unassuming residential portion of Balboa.  Hubby always wanted to try Uncle Boy's since we've passed by it numerous times and he's a burger fanatic.  The burgers are a drunkie's dream.  And my hubby got one of them.  It was called the Italian Stallion and had marinara sauce, pepperjack with jalapeño poppers and lettuce.  I got the Nephews burger which had a slice of jack, lettuce, tomatoes and pesto sauce.  There were two  employees there, one female and one male.  Thank goodness that the female was making our burgers, as the male didn't seem to regard taking off his gloves when he was doing certain things.  He may have been newer too as it looked like she was showing him what to do.  

We took our burgers to go and it took about 15 minutes for us to drive back home.  The pesto sauce was delicious (store bought though). The burgers were a good size and at an affordable price.  However, I wished both burgers were juicy.  His sounds like the ultimate drunk food, but the jalapeno poppers were soggy.  The burger wasn't bad, it was just odd and we wouldn't order them again.  Fries were well seasoned and some were crisp.  Overall, it's not a destination spot, but a solid place in the area when the burger craving hits.  Gotta give them props for some creative items!

excerpts: The Italian Stallion Burger was so tasty.
italian stallion burger.author: Jeff G.
italian stallion burger.review: This place had good reviews on Yelp and within walking distance of our doctor appointment. The Italian Stallion Burger was so tasty. My wife really liked the Cowboy Burger and my daughter said that these are the best mozzarella sticks that she's ever had, and she's tried many throughout the country. Very personable staff. Great prices. We will definitely return when we are in the area.

excerpts: Mom the El Jefe, bro the Chicken Tenders and Mozzrella Sticks.
All were combos with fries and fountain drinks.
The nice order lady helped me through the order.
Not more than 5 minutes later it was ready.
However, somewhere between the nice order lady and the chef they forgot our mozzarella sticks.
Mom loved the El Jefe and finished it off.
She hardly ever finishes a burger.
And bro had too much between his chicken tenders and mozzarella sticks
so your truly poached some.
That chef is maestro with the fryer.
The tenders and stick where great.
Great flavor and perfectly cooked.
el jefe.author: Steve G.
el jefe.review:
Was looking for a burger place in the Richmond/USF area.  Uncle Boys popped up and looked good so off we went.  Located on a mostly residential Balboa street with plenty of street parking.

This place is really small.  Behind the counter is the grill.  2 people working - the chef and an order taker.  Was looking around and couldn't find a menu so the nice order lady pointed it out.  I was surprised at how many items they for such a small place - not only burgers, but chicken, veggie burger, wings, chicken tenders, and a host of appetizers.

I opted for the O.G. with cheese, Mom the El Jefe, bro the Chicken Tenders and Mozzrella Sticks.  All were combos with fries and fountain drinks.  The nice order lady helped me through the order.  Not more than 5 minutes later it was ready.  However, somewhere between the nice order lady and the chef they forgot our mozzarella sticks.  I asked for them and they were ready in 2 minutes.

The burgers were really good.  Fresh veggies, perfectly cooked.  Toasted bun.  Yum,yum, yum.  Mom loved the El Jefe and finished it off.  She hardly ever finishes a burger.  And bro had too much between his chicken tenders and mozzarella sticks so your truly poached some.  That chef is maestro with the fryer.  The tenders and stick where great.  Great flavor and perfectly cooked.  No limp tenders or sticks at Uncle Boys.

Great food, very reasonable prices, and nice friendly people.  Only issue is finding a place to sit and eat.  But we'll deal with that.  Uncle Boys, we'll be back.

excerpts: Both the Cowboy and El Jefe are delicious.
The people are extremely nice.
Best burger spot in the Inner Richmond.
el jefe.author: Lisa W.
el jefe.review: Burgers are super tasty, highly recommend. Both the Cowboy and El Jefe are delicious. The people are extremely nice. Best burger spot in the Inner Richmond.

excerpts: I had the "El Jefe" after asking the owner (cook) for a recommendation.
I couldn't have had a more heavenly experience in my mouth and for only $10 and some change!
My boyfriend has the "Ain't No Punk" combo that is vegetarian!
The fries were also really yummy with plenty of pepper for taste.
There are burgers, chicken sandwiches, and vegetarian options along with sides like fries and onion rings.
el jefe.author: Genesis G.
el jefe.review:
Uncle Boy's has delicious food and excellent people working there! My boyfriend and I enjoyed our combos along with pleasant convos with the cook and waitress. I had the "El Jefe" after asking the owner (cook) for a recommendation. I couldn't have had a more heavenly experience in my mouth and for only $10 and some change!  My boyfriend has the "Ain't No Punk" combo that is vegetarian! The fries were also really yummy with plenty of pepper for taste. There are burgers, chicken sandwiches, and vegetarian options along with sides like fries and onion rings. Don't forget that there's a free drink with the check in. 

We were very pleased with this friendly customer care and loved every bite. Definitely a must to stop by Uncle Boy's whenever in San Francisco!

excerpts: My girlfriend ordered the "El Jefe" burger which was really spicy but great for anyone who's up for it.
el jefe.author: Andrew A.
el jefe.review:
Came here with my girlfriend visiting from LA. Stopped for a bite to eat before hitting the museum. Such a great eating experience! The place is small but more cozy than anything. The two people working there were extremely polite and charismatic. They seemed genuinely interested in getting to know us and that's all before we ate! 

The food was delicious. $10.00 and some change gets you a hearty burger, lots of fries, and a drink.  I got the Aint No Punk Veggie burger which was fantastic! Moderately spicy and flavorful. My girlfriend ordered the "El Jefe" burger which was really spicy but great for anyone who's up for it.

excerpts: The el jefe burger has a chipotle aioli that will rock your socks off and the fries are seasoned really well.
We will for sure be coming back!!!
el jefe.author: Nick D.
el jefe.review: This place was amazing, like Ikes of the burger world. Me and my lady had a fantastic meal at a reasonable price! The el jefe burger has a chipotle aioli that will rock your socks off and the fries are seasoned really well. We will for sure be coming back!!!

excerpts: El Jefe burger was GREAT!
Place is small and only street parking available.
Service is not their forte so I will not go out of my way to return.
el jefe.author: Lucy R.
el jefe.review: El Jefe burger was GREAT! Place is small and only street parking available.Service is not their forte so I will not go out of my way to return.

excerpts: I got the El Jefe
and it was amazing.
I would highly recommend this burger place.
el jefe.author: Shaneel A.
el jefe.review: This place is very good if you want a burger and soft drink. The fries are amazing, seasoned, and the burger grilled to your specifications. The staff was very friendly and helpful in deciding a burger. I got the El Jefe and it was amazing. I would highly recommend this burger place.

excerpts: Ordered the hot mess burger changed the hot mess sauce to mayo and mustard.
(Not a fan of hot sauce on a burger).
Fries where a perfect crisp seasoned well, burger was juicy delicious and cooked to order w/ a drink.
Decently affordable and good eatin' I would suggest going here And would definitely go again.
hot mess burger.author: Bryan P.
hot mess burger.review: I'd have to say, this burger place was delicious. Ordered the hot mess burger changed the hot mess sauce to mayo and mustard. (Not a fan of hot sauce on a burger). Fries where a perfect crisp seasoned well, burger was juicy delicious and cooked to order w/ a drink. Decently affordable and good eatin' I would suggest going here And would definitely go again.

excerpts: Ordered the hot mess burger, mozzarella sticks and wings.
Delivery was plenty quick, 20 minutes of eat24's tracking.
Burger was a great kinda mess!!
Mozzarella sticks had a ton of flavor, and the wings are exactly the way they should be, hot and crunchy!!
I'll definitely be ordering again.
hot mess burger.author: Curtis A.
hot mess burger.review: Ordered the hot mess burger, mozzarella sticks and wings. Delivery was plenty quick, 20 minutes of eat24's tracking. Burger was a great kinda mess!! Mozzarella sticks had a ton of flavor, and the wings are exactly the way they should be, hot and crunchy!! I'll definitely be ordering again.

excerpts: Came here after walking the 6 mile AIDS walk and got the hot mess burger...
oh boy!
I finished it in 10 mins.
I wasnt even hungry
but it was way way way too delicious.
Will be back :)
hot mess burger.author: Shiela V.
hot mess burger.review: Came here after walking the 6 mile AIDS walk and got the hot mess burger...oh boy! I finished it in 10 mins. I wasnt even hungry but it was way way way too delicious. Will be back :)

excerpts: The "hot mess burger" was true to its name, but the staff was so sweet and not only provided a plethora of napkins and utensils, but they also tossed in some complementary fries and a drink.
Overall I thought that it was the perfect place for a burger lover to find an extremely filling burger in San Francisco.
hot mess burger.author: Maritza M.
hot mess burger.review: AMAZING! SCRUMPTIOUS! ORGASMIC! The "hot mess burger" was true to its name, but the staff was so sweet and not only provided a plethora of napkins and utensils, but they also tossed in some complementary fries and a drink. Overall I thought that it was the perfect place for a burger lover to find an extremely filling burger in San Francisco.

excerpts: But damn, my hot mess burger was amazing.
Perfectly indulgent, juicy, and the right amount of spiciness.
Bacon was perfectly crisp.
The hot mess was a lot fluffier than my bf's pool boy burger though, so I had to use like 20 napkins to eat my burger since it was so big and dripping all over the place.
Perfect place to stop by if you want some fast, good quality grub.
hot mess burger.author: Jacqueline K.
hot mess burger.review: Unimpressive looking on the outside but a hidden gem (or close to it) on the inside. The SF memorabilia adds a nice local touch and makes me feel nostalgic for a time I never experienced. Service is good, but as a warning, they supposedly close at 10 pm but when we went in at 8:50 pm, they changed their sign to "closed" and were only really taking phone orders, so I would call first if it's late in the night. We ordered the hot mess and pool boy burgers with fries. Fries I would pass on; they were too "potato-y" if you know what I mean.. not bad but I like my fries thinner and crispier. But damn, my hot mess burger was amazing. Perfectly indulgent, juicy, and the right amount of spiciness. Bacon was perfectly crisp. The hot mess was a lot fluffier than my bf's pool boy burger though, so I had to use like 20 napkins to eat my burger since it was so big and dripping all over the place. Perfect place to stop by if you want some fast, good quality grub.

excerpts: But tonight, I ordered the "main chick", supposedly a 4 oz flame grilled chicken breast, and I ordered it without the bun.
When I got home I was shocked at the size of the protein.
I put it on a food scale...1.6 oz.
Not a typo!!
Sad to say it, but this is one neighborhood joint we'll be skipping in the future.
main chick.author: Carissa M.
main chick.review: Something has definitely changed at uncle boy's. For a quick neighborhood burger, this place was a great spot. But tonight, I ordered the "main chick", supposedly a 4 oz flame grilled chicken breast, and I ordered it without the bun. When I got home I was shocked at the size of the protein. I put it on a food scale...1.6 oz.  Not a typo!! 1.6 oz. Sad to say it, but this is one neighborhood joint we'll be skipping in the future.

excerpts: I ordered the main chick and the OG with cheddar cheese.
We couldn't decide on the sides
main chick.author: Michelle A.
main chick.review: Amazing food and service!  I ordered the main chick and the OG with cheddar cheese.  We couldn't decide on the sides so we ordered fries, zucchini chips and onion rings. All were delicious! Seating is limited so be prepared to stand for a bit-well worth it though! The staff were super friendly and sweet. I'll be back for sure!

excerpts: I ordered the Main Chick and it was pretty much a basic chicken burger.
The aesthetic of the joint is pretty much a local burger joint
so it's pretty small with a couple of seats on the inside.
The people are very kind
so service is great.
Food is pretty basic for a burger joint, nothing too spectacular.
Fries could have been a bit more crispier.
main chick.author: Lola H.
main chick.review: Stopped by here when I was leaving the de Young Museum and was on my way to the Legion of Honor. I ordered the Main Chick and it was pretty much a basic chicken burger. The aesthetic of the joint is pretty much a local burger joint so it's pretty small with a couple of seats on the inside. The people are very kind so service is great. Food is pretty basic for a burger joint, nothing too spectacular. Fries could have been a bit more crispier.

excerpts: This explains why I spend $10.89 on the Main Chick combo.
Their fries are a tad bit over seasoned most times
but I just shake off the salt n pepper and deal with it.
I'd give them 5 stars if they didn't randomly close!!!!
All in all, this is my cheat day spot
and I'll keep going here forever.
main chick.author: Tania C.
main chick.review: Uncle Boy's is pretty expensive but there aren't many places that serve fresh burgers in the city. This explains why I spend $10.89 on the Main Chick combo. Their fries are a tad bit over seasoned most times but I just shake off the salt n pepper and deal with it. I'd give them 5 stars if they didn't randomly close!!!! All in all, this is my cheat day spot and I'll keep going here forever.

excerpts: I like the Main Chick and Fries are not bad.
I would like them to commit to natural, no antibiotics or hormones for the prices they charge.
main chick.author: Ben M.
main chick.review: I'm glad it's in the neighborhood!  I like the Main Chick and Fries are not bad.  I would like them to commit to natural, no antibiotics or hormones for the prices they charge.

excerpts: I had the Side Chick Sandwich with no chipotle and it was so delicious (when it wasn't raw).
The cheese was melted, the roll was soft, and all together it was just a darn good delicious sandwich.
I want to try this place again, but I will always be cautious of those first few bites of chicken.
side chick.author: Larissa S.
side chick.review:
I'm only giving this place 3 stars because the first chicken sandwich I ordered was raw in the middle.

I was given a replacement and holy smokes it was good! I had the Side Chick Sandwich with no chipotle and it was so delicious (when it wasn't raw). The cheese was melted, the roll was soft, and all together it was just a darn good delicious sandwich. I want to try this place again, but I will always be cautious of those first few bites of chicken.

excerpts: My favorites are the "unhorsed cowboy" (Bacon cheese burger with onion rings) and his side chick (grilled chicken with spicy sauce).
side chick.author: Nate C.
side chick.review:
Great burger joint! My favorites are the "unhorsed cowboy" (Bacon cheese burger with onion rings) and his side chick (grilled chicken with spicy sauce). The prices are very good considering the amount of food and quality. 

I'd say one downside is if you want to go with a group of people, the seating is limited. Just a few small tables along the wall and some seating by the window. Also, i've been lucky enough to go when it wasn't really busy so service has been really good, but I can see how people have to wait awhile because there is usually only one guy working there at a time.

If you're in the inner richmond area, these are the best burgers you'll find.

excerpts: had so far, from the side chick to the dog in heat (yes, the names are entertainement in itself) are AMAZING.
Creative names, creative combinations, completely juicy and yumminess, and the best part......very affordable.
Not one of these places in the city that rip you off for an average burger, this place puts a unique twist on your basic burger and doesnt try to rob your pockets.
I definately will be coming back again n again.
Thanks Uncle Boys!
side chick.author: Justine S.
side chick.review: One Word: YUM!!! Everything Ive had so far, from the side chick to the dog in heat (yes, the names are entertainement in itself) are AMAZING.  Creative names, creative combinations, completely juicy and yumminess, and the best part......very affordable. Not one of these places in the city that rip you off for an average burger, this place puts a unique twist on your basic burger and doesnt try to rob your pockets.  I definately will be coming back again n again.  Thanks Uncle Boys!
